07fbe3f6-89b8-4bfd-ba28-0c64216f5a3d.description: Individuals who hold the CRPC™ designation have completed a course of study encompassing pre-and post-retirement needs, asset management, estate planning and the entire retirement planning process using models and techniques from real client situations. Additionally, individuals must pass an end-of-course examination that tests their ability to synthesize complex concepts and apply theoretical concepts to real-life situations.
07fbe3f6-89b8-4bfd-ba28-0c64216f5a3d.name: Chartered Retirement Planning Counselor™ or CRPC™ Professional Designation

issuer.summary: issued by College for Financial Planning

alignments.name: Higher Learning Commission (HLC)
alignments.description: The College for Financial Planning, Inc., is accredited by the Higher Learning Commission (HLC) and is a member of the North Central Association (NCA).

alignments.name: Colorado Commission on Higher Education (CCHE)
alignments.description: The College for Financial Planning has been authorized by the Colorado Commission on Higher Education (CCHE) to offer instruction for and to grant the Master of Science (MS) and Master of Science in Finance (MSF) degrees.

alignments.name: North American Securities Administrators Association (NASAA)
alignments.description: The North American Securities Administrators Association (NASAA) and numerous states have enacted regulations or legislation dealing with the use of “senior” designations used by financial planning practitioners, to separate designations that have credible requirements and academic rigor from those that have less stringent or no requirements.

badge_template_activities.title: Students study a series of industry specific education materials and attend virtual classes in order to successfully complete a final examination.
All designees have agreed to adhere to Standards of Professional Conduct and are subject to a disciplinary process.
In order to maintain their designation, students must complete 16 hours of CE every 2 years.

56c26927-ea3f-489c-abb2-e47025e0055a.description: Individuals who hold the AAMS™ designation have completed a course of study encompassing investments, insurance, tax, retirement, and estate planning issues. Additionally, individuals must pass an end-of-course examination that tests their ability to synthesize complex concepts and apply theoretical concepts to real-life situations.
56c26927-ea3f-489c-abb2-e47025e0055a.name: Accredited Asset Management Specialist™ or AAMS™ Professional Designation

00a7eee5-9659-40ff-84de-2c13c509ae32.description: Individuals who hold the FPQP® designation have completed a course of study encompassing the financial planning process, the five disciplines of financial planning and general financial planning concepts, terminology and product categories. Additionally, individuals must pass an end-of-course examination that tests their ability to synthesize complex concepts and apply theoretical concepts to real-life situations.
00a7eee5-9659-40ff-84de-2c13c509ae32.name: Foundations in Financial Planning™ Program leading to the FPQP® Professional Designation

issuer.summary: issued by College for Financial Planning

alignments.description: The North American Securities Administrators Association (NASAA) and numerous states have enacted regulations or legislation dealing with the use of “senior” designations used by financial planning practitioners, to separate designations that have credible requirements and academic rigor from those that have less stringent or no requirements.

badge_template_activities.title: Students study a series of educational manuals and attend virtual classes in order to prepare for a final 100 question final examination. Students must score a 70% or better on the final examination.
All designees have agreed to adhere to Standards of Professional Conduct and are subject to a disciplinary process.
In order to maintain their designation, students must complete 16 hours of CE every 2 years.

9a7830b0-761b-4ee2-a641-9525e338d9ad.description: APMA™ designees have completed a course of study encompassing client assessment and suitability, risk/return, investment objectives, bond and equity portfolios, modern portfolio theory and investor psychology. With hands-on practice in analyzing investment policy statements, building portfolios, and making asset allocation decisions including sell, hold, and buy decisions within a client’s portfolio. Individuals must pass an end-of-course examination.
9a7830b0-761b-4ee2-a641-9525e338d9ad.name: Accredited Portfolio Management Advisor™ or APMA™ Professional Designation

5b0c0556-6b2b-45f5-a36d-c3aa81b19e69.description: Individuals who hold the AWMA™ designation have completed a course of study encompassing wealth strategies, equity-based compensation plans, tax reduction alternatives, and asset protection alternatives. Additionally, individuals must pass an end-of-course examination that tests their ability to synthesize complex concepts and apply theoretical concepts to real-life situations.
5b0c0556-6b2b-45f5-a36d-c3aa81b19e69.name: Accredited Wealth Management Advisor™ or AWMA™ Professional Designation

0365c734-b5ce-43f8-b4b4-210f20a6f735.description: Individuals who hold the CSRIC® designation posses a foundation of knowledge of the history, definitions, trends, portfolio construction principles, fiduciary responsibilities, and best practices for sustainable, responsible, and impact (SRI) investments. Additionally, individuals must pass an end-of-course examination that tests their ability to synthesize complex concepts and apply theoretical concepts to real-life situations.
0365c734-b5ce-43f8-b4b4-210f20a6f735.name: Chartered SRI Counselor™ or CSRIC® Professional Designation

d9bd4e46-6b5a-4050-b01f-40fafedf2a96.name: Wealth Management Specialist™ or WMS™ Professional Designation

f82b266c-f48d-4c03-834d-943d1d35bea6.name: Chartered Mutual Fund Counselor™ or CMFC™ Professional Designation

1550776f-c442-462d-89f3-9d96c4208558.description: Individuals that hold the LUTCF® designation have completed a program of study that includes 3 separate courses that focus on practice management, life insurance, insurance products, investment products, and risk management. Additionally, individuals must pass end-of-course examinations at the end of each course which test their ability to synthesize complex concepts and apply theoretical concepts to real-life situations.
1550776f-c442-462d-89f3-9d96c4208558.name: Life Underwriter Training Council Fellow℠ or LUTCF® Professional Designation

issuer.summary: issued by College for Financial Planning

alignments.name: National Association of Insurance and Financial Advisors (NAIFA)
alignments.description: The National Association of Insurance and Financial Advisors (NAIFA) is the sole owner of the Life Underwriter Training Council Fellow℠ and LUTCF® trademarks. NAIFA and the College (through a sublicense agreement) co-confer authorization to individuals to use the LUTCF® designation.

alignments.description: The North American Securities Administrators Association (NASAA) and numerous states have enacted regulations or legislation dealing with the use of “senior” designations used by financial planning practitioners, to separate designations that have credible requirements and academic rigor from those that have less stringent or no requirements.

badge_template_activities.title: Students study a series of educational manuals and attend physical or virtual classes in order to prepare for three 100 question examinations. Students must score a 70% or better on the three examinations in order to obtain the designation.
All designees have agreed to adhere to Standards of Professional Conduct and are subject to a disciplinary process.
In order to maintain their designation, students must complete 3 hours of Ethics CE every 2 years

ed16430d-3695-44d0-9129-17c99d65cbd3.description: MPAS™ designees have completed a Master of Science degree with a major in personal financial planning. The program consists of 30 semester credits and delves into personal financial planning or investment-related content. Graduates are required to demonstrate critical thinking skills and problem-solving techniques. Additionally, individuals must complete assignments, projects, research, and papers and meet all graduation requirements for the Master of Science degree.
ed16430d-3695-44d0-9129-17c99d65cbd3.name: Master Planner Advanced Studies™ or MPAS™ Professional Designation

issuer.summary: issued by College for Financial Planning

alignments.description: The North American Securities Administrators Association (NASAA) and numerous states have enacted regulations or legislation dealing with the use of “senior” designations used by financial planning practitioners, to separate designations that have credible requirements and academic rigor from those that have less stringent or no requirements.

badge_template_activities.title: Students must complete 30 graduate-level semester credit hours using research-based coursework and real-world case studies. Additionally, individuals must complete assignments, projects, research, and papers and meet all graduation requirements for the Master of Science degree.
All designees have agreed to adhere to Standards of Professional Conduct and are subject to a disciplinary process.
In order to maintain their designation, students must complete 45 hours of CE every 2 years.

f26dd685-56f5-4c43-809f-35c83ed7a865.description: Individuals who hold the ABFP™ designation have completed a course of study encompassing advisors’ emotional competencies, client interactions, and financial planning advice through a thorough understanding of psychological explanations for economic behavior and hands-on practice of knowledge.
f26dd685-56f5-4c43-809f-35c83ed7a865.name: Accredited Behavioral Finance Professional™ or ABFP™ Professional Designation

520de416-3dc4-4b79-824f-6f8fbe004616.description: Individuals who hold the SE-AWMA™ designation have completed a course of study encompassing qualitative planning, trusts, investments, cash flow, budgeting, tax planning, business planning, estate planning, employee and retirement benefits for high-net-worth sports and entertainment clients. Additionally, individuals must pass an end-of-course examination that tests their ability to synthesize complex concepts and apply theoretical concepts to real-life situations.
520de416-3dc4-4b79-824f-6f8fbe004616.name: Sports & Entertainment Accredited Wealth Management Advisor™ or SE-AWMA™ Professional Designation

b28d4a0d-4fe2-417e-b404-a69dee623690.description: Individuals who hold the ADPA™ designation have completed a course of study encompassing wealth transfers, federal taxation, retirement planning, and planning for financial and medical end-of-life needs for domestic partners. Additionally, individuals must pass an end-of-course examination that tests their ability to synthesize complex concepts and apply theoretical concepts to real-life situations.
b28d4a0d-4fe2-417e-b404-a69dee623690.name: Accredited Domestic Partnership Advisor™ or ADPA™ Professional Designation
